content.headline: Building Your Baby's Foundation Through Nutrition
content.intro: The nutrients you consume during pregnancy directly impact your baby's growth, brain development, and long-term health. Understanding which foods support specific developmental milestones helps you make informed choices for your baby's wellbeing.

sections.title: Essential Nutrients for Baby's Growth
sections.content: Focus on these key nutrients throughout pregnancy:
points: Folic acid: Critical for neural tube development in first trimester
Iron: Supports placenta development and prevents anemia
Calcium: Builds strong bones and teeth formation
Omega-3 DHA: Essential for brain and eye development
Protein: Building blocks for all cells and tissues
Choline: Supports brain development and prevents neural tube defects

sections.title: Developmental Timeline & Nutrition
sections.content: Match your nutrition to baby's developmental stages:
points: Weeks 1-12: Focus on folic acid for neural tube formation
Weeks 13-24: Increase protein for rapid growth phase
Weeks 25-40: Emphasize calcium and iron for bone and blood development
Throughout: Consistent omega-3 intake for brain development
Third trimester: Additional calories for baby's weight gain

sections.title: Foods to Support Development
points: Leafy greens: Rich in folate for early neural development
Lean meats & legumes: Protein sources for tissue building
Dairy products: Calcium for skeletal formation
Fatty fish: Omega-3s for brain and vision development
Whole grains: B vitamins for energy and nervous system
Colorful fruits/vegetables: Antioxidants for cell protection
